body: Hi Dave, it seems no JIRA for it, but it's helpful for Jekins testing.
Hi Dave, The JIRA is TRAFODION-2817 that i helped for the creating.
Looks like the conflicts need to be resolved before we can move further with this request.
FYI: I ran full regressions on this change overnight on a clean workstation instance. All passed.

-1
You may need to study RangeSpecs a bit more before solving this problem.

@DaveBirdsall Sure, I've fixed.
By the way, these two chapters (**Working with BLOB and CLOB Data** and **Managing the SQL Tables for BLOB and CLOB Data**) are not visible on the website: [http://trafodion.incubator.apache.org/docs/jdbct4ref_guide/index.html](url), could you please help rebuild the website? Many thanks!

Can you please update the tile of this PR to include JIRA number like [TRAFODION-2817]. This helps in automatic linking of the PR to the JIRA. Also, please provide some description in the PR that would help in reviewing this code.  

I guess the pom.xml is used to compile the associated java file.  It would be useful if you can describe how this plugin is invoked.
Can you please update the title of the PR with the JIRA heading at least.
Is this PR related to TRAFODION-2704?
If so, can you please update the title of the PR with this JIRA number like [TRAFODION-2704] for automatic linking of the PR to JIRA.

+1
Looks good to me, but I'm not familiar enough with merge statements to really review the second change. Maybe @sureshsubbiah or @sandhyasun can also take a look.
Even without the LOB chapters. I think this change is ready to merge as-is. I'll wait a day, though, in case you decide to include the LOB chapters as well.
FYI: I ran full regressions on this change last night on a workstation. All tests passed.

I went ahead and merged this change and rebuilt the web site. The LOB chapters can remain invisible for a while; it appears they are not ready. See this e-mail thread on the Trafodion dev list: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/incubator-trafodion-dev/201711.mbox/%3CMWHPR10MB161364FF25ADF87EB277A102E4380%40MWHPR10MB1613.namprd10.prod.outlook.com%3E
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/2210/

At  high level, this was done in multiple steps:
- use showcontrol to find out all cqds
- find out which file and code location they are used using greps etc
- insert the cqd and location (null if  not found) in our favorite database (Trafodion). 
- run queries to  find out cqd usage (how often it is used, top used cqds, total cqds,  unused cqds, etc)
- delete unused ones from DefaultConstants and nadefaults using another script.
  (some manual deletion of code comments is needed as you found out during your review).

Will clean up the scripts and deliver them in a subsequent checkin.

The next step in cqd removal is to look at cqds and where they are used. And then determine if
the code using them is obsolete and should also be removed.

Hi again, here is a suggestion: Change method OptRangeSpec::buildRange() and add a check whether a comparison operation (ITM_EQUAL, ITM_LESS, etc.) involves a case-inspecific comparison. If so, then set the local variable isRange to FALSE. This should avoid getting into this problem, as there will be no more RangeSpecs for case-inspecific comparisons.
I merged this change and rebuilt the manuals on the Trafodion web site just now. Thanks for this change.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Has this been tested on various  test cases where the table has multiple indexes and does it work in those cases where there is no view ?
Yes, @sandhyasun. It passed regression test executor/TEST015, which has examples of tables with multiple indexes and also no views.
+1. Changes look great. Thank you for explaining the change to me.

The file sql/langman//LmSQLMXDriver.java is obsolete and it is not used. Please remove this file from git. The T4 related changes in LmUtility.java might be used if anyone changes the default jdbc driver in stored procedure to jdbc T4 driver. By default, stored procedures use T2 driver.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/2223/

Your script ran afoul of the jenkins check that aims to make sure people do not submit un-merged code.
Maybe the check could be changed to only flag the merge markers at beginning of the line.

The very small issue I have is that this is being put in the sql/scripts directory, which is a dumping ground for end-user (admin) tools as well as developer tools. Everything there will be added to the binary deliverable package.  I hate to see developer stuff in the installed product..
I will merge this PR. You can open a different PR to take care of the requested enhancements
Please resolve the conflicts. Then it can be reviewed and merged
Have you tried out kdiff3 to aid you in merging. It is a GUI based diff tool that helps in resolving the conflicts easily.
